hints_html: What is the probability of an interval in terms of the probability density function?
hints_latex:
What is the probability of an interval in terms of the probability
density function?
hints_raw: What is the probability of an interval in terms of the probability density function?
question: 7 (b)
statement_html:
Streptococcus viridans bacteria divide along a preferred axis and therefore form chains when they divide. You study a population of S. viridans in a blood culture. Let X be the length (in µm) of a randomly chosen chain. Its distribution is described by the probability density function

\[\begin{aligned} p(x) = \frac1{x}, \quad 1 \leq x \leq e\end{aligned}\]

What is the probability of finding a chain of length at most 2µm?

\(P\{X\leq 2\}=\)
statement_latex:
\emph{Streptococcus viridans} bacteria divide along a preferred axis and
therefore form chains when they divide. You study a population of
\emph{S. viridans} in a blood culture. Let \emph{X} be the length (in
µm) of a randomly chosen chain. Its distribution is described by the
probability density function

\begin{align*}
p(x) = \frac1{x}, \quad 1 \leq x \leq e
\end{align*}

What is the probability of finding a chain of length at most 2µm?

$P\{X\leq 2\}=$
statement_raw:
''Streptococcus viridans'' bacteria divide along a preferred axis and therefore form chains when they divide. You study a population of ''S. viridans'' in a blood culture. Let ''X'' be the length (in µm) of a randomly chosen chain. Its distribution is described by the probability density function

:<math> p(x) = \frac1{x}, \quad 1 \leq x \leq e </math>

What is the probability of finding a chain of length at most 2µm?

<math>\ P\{X\leq 2\}=</math>
